page.title: 01Changing Lifestyles
page.content: On Tuesday 4th of June we interviewed some older people in Kenley Memorial Hall.We asked them some questions about the past.'This is good 'an old lady said.When we asked her about school she said most people liked it,but you had to go home for dinner as the school wouldn't supply it.Children were treated well. Today people have more money .There weren't any real jobs for girls but you could be a servant for Â£16:00 a year . When the lady I interviewed was young you could buy 2 packets of sweets for a ha'penny and a loaf of bread too. Many of the old people remembered the rations that they had during World War II .There were 2oz of butter ,half a pound of flour and small pieces of meat.
